content.raw:
Hi Brian,

Thank you for reporting this! I was trying to reuse the same pattern in two different situations. The other one involved matching "modX" in the middle of the sequence, so the end-of-line was not included in the pattern.
For this reason `is_modX` basically only checked if the label *starts* with a valid "modX" string, which is not the correct behavior. I changed that and also amended `is_term_mod`, which would previously return `True` for `'-'`. I updated doctests for these functions as well.
content.html:
Hi Brian,

Thank you for reporting this! I was trying to reuse the same pattern in two different situations. The other one involved matching "modX" in the middle of the sequence, so the end-of-line was not included in the pattern. For this reason is_modX basically only checked if the label starts with a valid "modX" string, which is not the correct behavior. I changed that and also amended is_term_mod, which would previously return True for '-'. I updated doctests for these functions as well.
